summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing law enforcement to search and analyze electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant lists specific items (iPhone, iPad, binders, CDs, hard drives) seized on or about July 6 and July 11, 2019, and authorizes a forensic review for evidence related to sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual from whom electronic devices (iPhone and iPad) were seized on or about July 6, 2019. The warrant authorizes a search of these items for evidence of sex trafficking offenses.

persons.name: Kevin Nathaniel
persons.context: Signed the search and seizure warrant as a judge of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York on July 15, 2019.

events.title: Seizure of Epstein's iPhone and iPad
events.description: Law enforcement seized a black iPhone and a silver iPad from Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Seizure of binders, CDs, and hard drives from suitcases
events.description: Law enforcement seized two black binders with CDs, two black hard drives, a box of CDs, and two binders with various CDs from blue and black suitcases.

events.title: Issuance of search warrant
events.description: Judge Kevin Nathaniel issued a search and seizure warrant authorizing forensic review of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A search warrant was issued on July 15, 2019, authorizing a forensic review of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein, including an iPhone and iPad taken from him on July 6, 2019.
Additional evidence seized on July 11, 2019, included multiple binders, CDs, and hard drives from suitcases, suggesting a collection of digital or recorded material.
The warrant specifically authorizes a search for evidence of violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking of minors) and 371 (conspiracy), indicating the focus of the investigation.
The authorized search includes looking for communications with co-conspirators, photographs of victims or potential victims, and 'child erotica.'
The warrant authorizes delayed notice of the search, indicating concerns about compromising the investigation.
